name: Endive and Quinoa Salad With Poached Egg
description: If you hesitate to buy salad greens that could wilt before you have a chance to use them, endive is a perfect solution. The tight bulbs will keep in your crisper for about a week without deteriorating. Make the dressing and keep what you don’t use in the refrigerator. It will keep until you use it up.
recipeYield: 1 main-dish serving or 2 side servings or starters
recipeCategory: dinner, for one, salads and dressings
keywords: eggs, endive, quinoa, gluten-free, healthy, high fiber, vegetarian
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar, Champagne vinegar or sherry vinegar (sherry vinegar is my preference)
Salt, preferably coarse sea salt or fleur de sel, to taste
6 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, or 4 tablespoons olive oil
1 1/2 endives, preferably a mix of red and green, cut crosswise into 3/4-inch slices
2 white or cremini mushrooms, thinly sliced
1/4 yellow bell pepper, cut crosswise in thin slices
1 teaspoon chopped fresh herbs, like tarragon and chives

recipeInstructions.text: Make the dressing first so that the garlic, which you’ll pull out before tossing the salad, can marinate. In a bowl or a glass measuring cup, whisk together the vinegars, salt, pepper and mustard. Whisk in the oils and add the garlic, which should be crushed so that it infuses the dressing. Let sit for 15 minutes. Remove the garlic, whisk the dressing and measure out 1 1/2 tablespoons. Transfer the remaining dressing to a jar or a squeeze bottle and refrigerate.
Combine the quinoa, endives, mushrooms, yellow pepper, herbs and Parmesan in a salad bowl. Add the 1 1/2 tablespoons dressing and toss together.
Poach the egg, if you have not done so already. Top the salad with the poached egg and enjoy.
